nodes.text: The cardio package was an cybernetic implant that micromanaged the cardiovascular system in order to increase the user's constitution faster and further than simple hard work and exercise would be capable of. It encouraged the brain to send vital chemicals to the heart and other organs, revitalizing them and giving the user greater physical reserves. It saw use on both sides during the Jedi Civil War between the Galactic Republic and Sith Empire. It could also be found in the stock of many vendors throughout the galaxy.

The cardio package first appeared as an equip-able item in the 2003 video game Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic. It later appeared in the game's 2004 sequel, Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords.
When equipped, the item increases the player's constitution stat by one. In order to be equipped, the player must have the "Implant Level 1" feat.

In Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic, this feat is automatically granted if the player chooses the scout class. If the player has the feat when beginning the game, a cardio package will be provided in the equipment footlocker that the player must collect to proceed.
